results.abstract: David Fincher’s new film about the making of “Citizen Kane” could be an Oscar favorite in a year dominated by streaming contenders.

results.title: Zoe Lister-Jones on ‘The Craft’ and Women’s Power
results.abstract: An outsider herself as a young woman, the director and actress wants teenage girls to relish a sense of community.

multimedia.caption: Often films about teenagers with special powers focus on how overwhelmed they are, Lister-Jones said. “I don’t think that’s a message we need to be giving to young women anymore. I think the more power, the better.”
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.title: They Scream! We Scream!
results.abstract: What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.

multimedia.caption: Susan Boyajian says there are “gradual screams, a buildup scream, kind of hyperventilating — say someone’s chasing you with a knife, and then you go into a scream.”
